page.title: 12The D.V.L.C. (Contd.)
page.content: at the D.V.L.C.. We know that there is tight security around the building because a pass is needed to get in and out. Before the D.V.L.C. was built the land was part of Clase Farm. A famous man, Oliver Cromwellonce stayed on the farm. Oliver Cromwell was Lord Protector. He was more important than the king. The army made him Lord Protector of the commonwealth of England, Scotland and Ireland. There is a rumour that ghosts inhabit the sixteenth floor of the D.V.L.C.. Maybe the ghost is Oliver Cromwell.The ghost story is that when people lock up, the doors open and papers fly out of the drawers and about the room. Helen Mort's grandmother(J1) used to clean the sixteenth floor and she believed that there were ghosts, so she retired.
